key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to raw material shortages and logistics delays
High dependence on the aerospace industry, which is cyclical and recovering unevenly post-pandemic
Competitive pressures from alternative materials and technologies
Energy-intensive production processes raising environmental concerns
controversies: Legal challenges related to employee treatment, including a case of discrimination and retaliation
Environmental concerns due to reliance on non-renewable energy sources

Energy-intensive production of carbon fibers and composites
social_issues: Employee treatment issues, including discrimination and retaliation cases
governance_issues: Legal liabilities from employee treatment cases potentially indicating governance weaknesses

sources.title: HEXCEL CORPORATION v. LABOR COMMISSION (2022) | FindLaw - FindLaw Caselaw
sources.snippet: Opinion ¶1 Hexcel Corporation (Hexcel) fired Michael Pickard, ostensibly because Pickard was caught napping during work hours. But just a few months earlier, Pickard had injured himself while working, and since then had been trying to get Hexcel to accommodate his injuries; Pickard believed that Hexcel fired him not because of his short nap but because it did not want to deal with his injuries.
